The speed of the deportations is an important detail. It's just like the 200+ men who were sent to El Salvador against Judge Boasberg's order. He ordered the planes to turn around and they didn't.  There's so much illegality in all these deportation cases. ICE has a lot to answer for. But the deportation of the boy with stage 4 cancer is particularly inhumane. Ripping the boy away from his home, his doctors, his treatments, and his community is something that can't be justified. There's no excuse. This doesn't make America safer.
